subject: entity-manager: Build entity inventory association
commitMessage:
entity-manager: Build entity inventory association

The entity inventory objects with physical connection would associate
with each other. Build the association based on the I2C topology.

As an illustration, assuming we have two entity config as follows:

{
  "Exposes": [
    {
      "Bus": "2",
      "Type": "I2CConnector",
      "Label": "PE0",
      ...
    },
    ...
  ]
  "Name": "Motherboard",
  "Type": "Board",
  ...
}

{
  "Exposes": [],
  "Probe": [
    "FOUND('Motherboard')",
    "AND",
    "xyz.openbmc_project.FruDevice({'PRODUCT_PRODUCT_NAME': 'Magic'})"
  ],
  "Name": "Magic",
  "Type": "Board",
  ...
}

The motherboard exposes an I2CConnector on I2C bus 2 that is a PCIE slot
in this example. When the add-in Magic board eeprom is also probed on
bus 2, this implementation will create association between the
motherboard and the Magic board. Also it publishes the connector label
as xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.LocationCode interface of the
Magic board. The association and location code indicate that the Magic
board is installed on motherboard via a connector with label PE0.

This implementation can detect physical connectivity among entities that
process an I2C EEPROM. The physical connectivity then can be applied to
construct the machine topology.

Tested:
Tested on a system with motherboard + IO riser + PCIE board. The
implementation can contruct expected association between motherboard and
IO riser and also association between IO riser and PCIE board.

Signed-off-by: Jie Yang <jjy@google.com>
Change-Id: I9739f3ab123c94fb1b479ab51c148dbf45eaeea0

Lots more details needed here.
Some details are in the design doc. Looks like it is not reviewed yet. I have got this worked on real systems. Will update the commit message with samples.

It looks like the associations is empty?

```
$ busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper \
    xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTree \
    sias /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory 0 \
    1 xyz.openbmc_project.Association.Definitions
a{sa{sas}} 0
```

Do I need to do anything to set it up properly. I have the option enabled so I know this code is being used.
compile with this option. This feature is disable in the default mode. check the meson_options.txt.
I have it enabled. But I guess it didn't do anything becuase I didn't have the silkscreen in the SMBIOS table.
The silkscreen name is in the linux, right? Is there an example of how that is setup?
All connector silkscreen names are written on the board. In our downstream most silkscreen names are hardcoded in SMBIOS tables. For PCIE slots it is in SMBIOS table type 9.
ok, I guess I am missing this
this code looks familiar.  Please don't duplicate code.
Ignore, looks like the latest patchset moves this code.  Ideally you should move code in a separate commit from the code making functional changes.
Why does this need to be an option?  Would we ever want to not expose the topology?
Ignore.  Looks like the option was removed.
What is an I2cConnector?  I don't think that terminology is allowed in the schema.  Ideally we shouldn't be hardcoding this kind of thing at all.

It describe a generic connector with I2C bus number pass-through. It can be PCIE slots or proprietary slots. I2C bus pass through the connector and then can be detected on another entity. Witch such info, we can associate entities
Please use get_if to avoid a second type check.  Also, please use the unsigned visitor pattern we have elsewhere.
This is adding almost 200 lines to a function that is already too long.  Please break it up in a logical way, abstracting things as neeeded.
will do.
Why uint32_t?
this number is just to label the entities and connectors. Can be any unsigned type.
Is this new interface documented?
yes. https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/46806
Why are we hardcoding this type?  This whole set of checks seems out of place.
we want to expose the association to bmcweb. since board type in bmc is represented by Chassis Schema. So use contains and containedby ObjectMapper Association forward and reverse type.

Ed mentioned that these terms are too generic.

Can it be chassinedByChassis and chassinesChassis
This should be done as part of the entity config file if needed.

Here our use case is to use the silkscreen name of connector as the LocationCode of connected entities. For example when a drive installed on a PCIe slots with silkscreen name "PE0" of motherboard, we want the LocationCode of the drive is "PE0". Also such connection can be dynamic so that can not be hardcoded in the entity config. I agree that this is not needed by all users. Might add a compiling flag here?
Rebase to solve conflicts. Is anyone actively working on this?
I think Zhenwei should be taking this over.
